profiles.description: (beta) can override be used to build, test or deploy configuration.

artifacts.description: lists the images you're going to be building.

tagPolicy.description: (beta) determines how images are tagged. A few strategies are provided here, although you most likely won't need to care! The policy can be gitCommit (beta), sha256 (beta), envTemplate (beta) or dateTime (beta). If not specified, it defaults to gitCommit: {}.

local.description: describes how to do a build on the local docker daemon and optionally push to a repository.

googleCloudBuild.description: describes how to do a remote build on Google Cloud Build.

kaniko.description: describes how to do an on-cluster build using Kaniko.

BuildConfig.description: contains all the configuration for the build steps.

ExecutionEnvironment.description: the environment in which the build should run (ex. local or in-cluster, etc.)

BuilderPlugin.description: contains all fields necessary for specifying a build plugin

gitCommit.description: tags images with the git tag or git commit of the artifact workspace directory.

sha256.description: tags images with their sha256 digest.

envTemplate.description: tags images with a configurable template string.

dateTime.description: tags images with the build timestamp.

TagPolicy.description: contains all the configuration for the tagging step.

ShaTagger.description: contains the configuration for the SHA tagger.

GitTagger.description: contains the configuration for the git tagger.

template.description: used to produce the image name and tag. See golang text/template syntax. The template is compiled and executed against the current environment, with those variables injected: IMAGE_NAME | Name of the image being built, as supplied in the artifacts section.

EnvTemplateTagger.description: tags images with a configurable template string.

format.description: formats the date and time. See #Time.Format.

timezone.description: sets the timezone for the date and time. See Time.LoadLocation. Defaults to the local timezone.

DateTimeTagger.description: tags images with the build timestamp.

local.description: describes how to do a build on the local docker daemon and optionally push to a repository.

googleCloudBuild.description: describes how to do a remote build on Google Cloud Build.

kaniko.description: describes how to do an on-cluster build using Kaniko.

BuildType.description: contains the specific implementation and parameters needed for the build step. Only one field should be populated.

push.description: should images be pushed to a registry. If not specified, images are pushed only if the current Kubernetes context connects to a remote cluster.

useDockerCLI.description: use docker command-line interface instead of Docker Engine APIs.

useBuildkit.description: use BuildKit to build Docker images.

LocalBuild.description: describes how to do a build on the local docker daemon and optionally push to a repository.

projectId.description: the ID of your Cloud Platform Project. If it is not provided, Skaffold will guess it from the image name. For example, given the artifact image name gcr.io/myproject/image, Skaffold will use the myproject GCP project.

diskSizeGb.description: the disk size of the VM that runs the build. See Cloud Build Reference.

machineType.description: the type of the VM that runs the build. See Cloud Build Reference.

timeout.description: the amount of time (in seconds) that this build should be allowed to run. See Cloud Build Reference.

dockerImage.description: the image that runs a Docker build. See Cloud Builders.

mavenImage.description: the image that runs a Maven build. See Cloud Builders.

gradleImage.description: the image that runs a Gradle build. See Cloud Builders.

GoogleCloudBuild.description: describes how to do a remote build on Google Cloud Build. Docker and Jib artifacts can be built on Cloud Build. The projectId needs to be provided and the currently logged in user should be given permissions to trigger new builds.

LocalDir.description: configures how Kaniko mounts sources directly via an emptyDir volume.

gcsBucket.description: the CGS bucket to which sources are uploaded by Skaffold. Kaniko will need access to that bucket to download the sources.

localDir.description: configures how Kaniko mounts sources directly via an emptyDir volume.

KanikoBuildContext.description: contains the different fields available to specify a Kaniko build context.

repo.description: a remote repository to store cached layers. If none is specified, one will be inferred from the image name. See Kaniko Caching.

KanikoCache.description: configures Kaniko caching. If a cache is specified, Kaniko will use a remote cache which will speed up builds.

buildContext.description: defines where Kaniko gets the sources from.

cache.description: configures Kaniko caching. If a cache is specified, Kaniko will use a remote cache which will speed up builds.

flags.description: additional flags to be passed to Kaniko command line. See Kaniko Additional Flags.

pullSecret.description: the path to the secret key file. See Kaniko Documentation.

pullSecretName.description: the name of the Kubernetes secret for pulling the files from the build context and pushing the final image.

namespace.description: the Kubernetes namespace. Defaults to current namespace in Kubernetes configuration.

timeout.description: the amount of time (in seconds) that this build is allowed to run. Defaults to 20 minutes (20m).

image.description: the Docker image used by the Kaniko pod. Defaults to the latest released version of gcr.io/kaniko-project/executor.

dockerConfig.description: describes how to mount the local Docker configuration into the Kaniko pod.

KanikoBuild.description: describes how to do an on-cluster build using Kaniko.

secretName.description: the Kubernetes secret that will hold the Docker configuration.

DockerConfig.description: contains information about the docker config.json to mount.

image.description: the artifact on which to run those tests.

structureTests.description: lists the Container Structure Tests to run on that artifact.

TestCase.description: a list of structure tests to run on images that Skaffold builds.

kubectl.description: uses a client side kubectl apply to apply the manifests to the cluster. You'll need a kubectl CLI version installed that's compatible with your cluster.

kustomize.description: uses the kustomize CLI to "patch" a deployment for a target environment.

DeployConfig.description: contains all the configuration needed by the deploy steps.

kubectl.description: uses a client side kubectl apply to apply the manifests to the cluster. You'll need a kubectl CLI version installed that's compatible with your cluster.

kustomize.description: uses the kustomize CLI to "patch" a deployment for a target environment.

DeployType.description: contains the specific implementation and parameters needed for the deploy step. Only one field should be populated.

manifests.description: lists the Kubernetes yaml or json manifests.

remoteManifests.description: lists Kubernetes manifests in remote clusters.

KubectlDeploy.description: contains the configuration needed for deploying with kubectl apply.

global.description: additional flags passed on every command.

apply.description: additional flags passed on creations (kubectl apply).

delete.description: additional flags passed on deletions (kubectl delete).

KubectlFlags.description: additional flags passed on the command line to kubectl either on every command (Global), on creations (Apply) or deletions (Delete).

flags.description: Optional flags to send to the helm command

HelmDeploy.description: contains the configuration needed for deploying with helm.

HelmDeployFlags.description: describes additional options flags that are passed on the command line to helm either on every command (Global), on install (Install) or on update (Update).

KustomizeDeploy.description: contains the configuration needed for deploying with kustomize.

name.description: the name of the Helm release.

chartPath.description: the path to the Helm chart.

valuesFiles.description: the paths to the Helm values files".

values.description: key-value pairs supplementing the Helm values file".

setValues.description: key-value pairs. If present, Skaffold will send --set flag to Helm CLI and append all pairs after the flag.

setValueTemplates.description: key-value pairs. If present, Skaffold will try to parse the value part of each key-value pair using environment variables in the system, then send --set flag to Helm CLI and append all parsed pairs after the flag.

wait.description: if true, Skaffold will send --wait flag to Helm CLI.

recreatePods.description: if true, Skaffold will send --recreate-pods flag to Helm CLI.

overrides.description: key-value pairs. If present, Skaffold will build a Helm values file that overrides the original and use it to call Helm CLI (--f flag).

packaged.description: parameters for packaging helm chart (helm package).

imageStrategy.description: adds image configurations to the Helm values file.

version.description: sets the version on the chart to this semver version.

appVersion.description: sets the appVersion on the chart to this version.

HelmPackaged.description: parameters for packaging helm chart (helm package).

fqn.description: the image configuration uses the syntax IMAGE-NAME=IMAGE-REPOSITORY:IMAGE-TAG.

helm.description: the image configuration uses the syntax IMAGE-NAME.repository=IMAGE-REPOSITORY, IMAGE-NAME.tag=IMAGE-TAG.

HelmImageStrategy.description: adds image configurations to the Helm values file.

fqn.description: the image configuration uses the syntax IMAGE-NAME=IMAGE-REPOSITORY:IMAGE-TAG.

helm.description: the image configuration uses the syntax IMAGE-NAME.repository=IMAGE-REPOSITORY, IMAGE-NAME.tag=IMAGE-TAG.

HelmFQNConfig.description: the image config to use the FullyQualifiedImageName as param to set.

HelmConventionConfig.description: the image config in the syntax of image.repository and image.tag.

image.description: the name of the image to be built.

context.description: the directory where the artifact's sources are to be found.

sync.description: lists local files that can be synced to remote pods (alpha) instead of triggering an image build when modified. This is a mapping of local files to sync to remote folders.

plugin.description: The plugin used to build this artifact

docker.description: describes an artifact built from a Dockerfile, usually using docker build.

bazel.description: requires bazel CLI to be installed and the artifacts sources to contain Bazel configuration files.

jibMaven.description: builds images using the Jib plugin for Maven.

jibGradle.description: builds images using the Jib plugin for Gradle.

Artifact.description: the items that need to be built, along with the context in which they should be built.

patches.description: a list of patches that will modify the default configuration. This is used to not replace a whole configuration section but change a few values. Each patch uses the JSON patch notation. For example, this profile will replace the dockerfile value of the first artifact by Dockerfile.DEV.

activation.description: criteria by which a profile can be auto-activated. This can be based on Environment Variables, the current Kubernetes context name, or depending on which Skaffold command is running.

Profile.description: (beta) profiles are used to override any build, test or deploy configuration.

env.description: holds a key=value pair. The profile is auto-activated if an Environment Variable key has value value.

kubeContext.description: a Kubernetes context for which a profile is auto-activated.

command.description: a Skaffold command for which a profile is auto-activated.

Activation.description: criteria by which a profile is auto-activated.

docker.description: describes an artifact built from a Dockerfile, usually using docker build.

bazel.description: requires bazel CLI to be installed and the artifacts sources to contain Bazel configuration files.

jibMaven.description: builds images using the Jib plugin for Maven.

jibGradle.description: builds images using the Jib plugin for Gradle.

dockerfile.description: locates the Dockerfile relative to workspace.

buildArgs.description: arguments passed to the docker build.

cacheFrom.description: lists the Docker images to consider as cache sources.

target.description: the Dockerfile target name to build.

DockerArtifact.description: describes an artifact built from a Dockerfile, usually using docker build.

args.description: additional args to pass to bazel build.

BazelArtifact.description: describes an artifact built with Bazel.

module.description: selects which Maven module to build, for a multi module project.

profile.description: selects which Maven profile to activate.

args.description: additional build flags passed to Maven.

JibMavenArtifact.description: builds images using the Jib plugin for Maven.

project.description: selects which Gradle project to build.

args.description: additional build flags passed to Gradle.

JibGradleArtifact.description: builds images using the Jib plugin for Gradle.
